fields.name: 2Pac
fields.description: Tupac Amaru Shakur better known by his stage name 2Pac was an American rapper, songwriter, and actor. He is considered by many to be one of the most influential rappers of all time. My favourite lyric and what inspired me to draw this is 'Everybody's at war with different things, I'm at war with my own heart sometimes'.

fields.name: Axl Rose
fields.description: Axl Rose is an American musician, singer, songwriter and record producer and is the lead vocalist and lyricist of the hard rock band Guns N' Roses since 1985. Taken from the song This I love, my favourite lyric and what inspired me to draw this is 'I've searched the universe and found myself within her eyes'.

fields.name: Bob Marley
fields.description: Bob Marley was a Jamaican singer, songwriter, and musician. and is considered one of the pioneers of reggae music.  My favourite Bob Marley quote and what inspired me to draw this is 'Don't gain the world and lose your soul, wisdom is better than silver or gold.'.

fields.name: Boy and his dog
fields.description: I painted this from a photo I took of a family member walking their dog up the Bank Walk in Donegal Town.

fields.name: Clint Eastwood
fields.description: I was inspired to draw this after going through a phase of watching Clint Eastwood western films, specifically from The Good, The Bad and The Ugly.

fields.name: David Bowie
fields.description: Taken from the song Stay by David Bowie, - 'You can never really tell when somebody wants something you want too'. This lyric inspired me to draw this.

fields.name: Dean Martin
fields.description: 'Still in peaceful dreams I see the road leads back to you' is a lyric from Georgia on my Mind sung by Dean Martin and really inspired to paint this.

fields.name: Drake
fields.description: Drake is a Canadian rapper, singer, songwriter, actor, record producer, and entrepreneur. 'Sometimes I wish I could go back in life, not to change things, just to feel a couple things twice' is a quote from him and inspired me to draw this.

fields.name: James Deane
fields.description: James Deane was an American actor back in the early 1950s and tragically died in a car crash aged only 24. A film quote from Rebel without a cause -  'You are tearing me apart! You say one thing, he says another, and everybody changes back again' inspired me to draw this picture.

fields.name: John Wayne
fields.description: John Wayne was an American actor and director. He was asked if he had any advice for up and coming actors. He said 'Talk low, talk slow and don't talk too much' and this inspired me to draw this.

fields.name: Johnny Cash
fields.description: Johnny Cash was an American singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. 'I never got over those blue eyes, I see them everywhere' is a lyric from the song I Still Miss Someone sung by him inspired me to draw this.  I use dark monotones which I feel reflect his troubled life as he struggled with both depression and addictions.

fields.name: Johnny Cash
fields.description: Johnny Cash was an American singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. 'I'll try to carry off a little darkness on my back, 'till things are brighter I'm the man in black' is a lyric from the song Man in Black by Johnny Cash and this inspired me to draw this. I use dark monotones which I feel reflect his troubled life as he struggled with both depression and addictions.

fields.name: Leonard Cohen
fields.description: Leonard Cohen was a Canadian singer, songwriter, poet, and novelist. He is one of my favourite poets/lyricists. I'm actually obsessed with his writings! He had such an articulate yet profound way with words and had the ability to express the most painful things in the most beautiful way. He had such a deep understanding of the world and the human condition, and his interviews are so insightful to watch. I usually paint him in monotone as I feel it reflects his dark, empathetic persona. A quote from him was 'I don't consider myself a pessimist. I think of a pessimist as someone who is waiting for it to rain. And I feel soaked to the skin.' and this inspired me to paint this.

fields.name: Leonard Cohen
fields.description: Leonard Cohen was a Canadian singer, songwriter, poet, and novelist. He is one of my favourite poets/lyricists. I'm actually obsessed with his writings! He had such an articulate yet profound way with words and had the ability to express the most painful things in the most beautiful way. He had such a deep understanding of the world and the human condition, and his interviews are so insightful to watch. I usually paint him in monotone as I feel it reflects his dark, empathetic persona. A quote from him was 'In my experience, there is no
There's no-one whom I can locate as
And, dissolving the search for
is relaxation... it's the content of peace' and this inspired me to paint this, a young Leonard Cohen.

fields.name: Prince
fields.description: Prince was an American singer-songwriter, musician, record producer, dancer, actor, and filmmaker. He once said 'A strong spirit transcends rules' and this inspired me to draw him.

fields.name: Stevie Wonder
fields.description: Stevie Wonder is an American singer, songwriter, musician and record producer and has been blind since shortly after his birth. He is in inspiration to me. He is known for his colourful outfits and upbeat, addictive melodies and so when I painted him, the colours I used are a lot brighter and stronger. He once said 'Just because a man lacks the use of his eyes doesn't mean he lacks vision' and this inspired me to draw him.

fields.name: Stevie Wonder
fields.description: Stevie Wonder is an American singer, songwriter, musician and record producer and has been blind since shortly after his birth. He is in inspiration to me. He is known for his colourful outfits and upbeat, addictive melodies and so when I painted him, the colours I used are a lot brighter and stronger. He once said 'Music is a world within itself with a language we all understand' and this inspired me to draw him.

fields.name: Forge Bar, Donegal Town
fields.description: This is The Forge Bar in Donegal Town which is a traditional Irish pub owned and run by my Dad.  When I was working in the bar and if it was quiet I would draw on post-it notes to keep myself amused. I would draw my favourite musicians and keep them behind the bar and if I was talking to a customer and they happened to mention they were a fan of someone I had drawn, I would give them the post-it note. I started drawing and leaving my post-it portraits in random places when I was travelling, (in the middle of magazines, inside pull-down trays on planes and trains, on counters and benches) and I eventually started to frame them and sell them as art pieces, the post it notes themselves are 5
and they're in 7
frames.

fields.name: Tom Waits
fields.description: Tom Waits is an American singer, songwriter, musician, composer, and actor. He has a trademark deep, gravelly voice.' Wasted and wounded, it ain't what the moon did, I got what I paid for now' is a lyric from Tom Traubert's Blues song and this inspired me to draw him.

fields.name: David Bowie
fields.description: David Bowie was an English singer-songwriter and actor. He was a leading figure in the music industry and is regarded as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century. Taken from the song Stay by him - 'You can never really tell when somebody wants something you want too'. This lyric inspired me to draw this.

fields.name: Noel Connelly & Pat Holmes
fields.description: This is a biro sketch of Noel Connelly and Pat Holmes who were joint managers of the Mayo Senior team.
